com.thesonofthom.tools

Class BufferMap.EnumNumberField<T extends java.lang.Enum<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.thesonofthom.tools.BufferMap.AbstractField
      • com.thesonofthom.tools.BufferMap.NumberField
        • com.thesonofthom.tools.BufferMap.EnumNumberField<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - - generic Enum type to be used when parsing the data in the field
    Enclosing class:
    BufferMap

    public class BufferMap.EnumNumberField<T extends java.lang.Enum<?>>
extends BufferMap.NumberField
    This class is for defining a field where each value has a specified meaning. You create an enum where each entry represents the different possible values (starting at 0, 1, 2, etc). The class simply uses the ordinal of the enum to match it with the field value, so by default no values can be skipped when declaring the enum. It will print the toString() of the enum when printing the buffer map. By default, this is simply the enum name, but you can override this when creating the enum. If you wish to have enums for arbitrary integers that do not have a definition for every possible value, have your enum implement the IntegerEnum interface. The enum should look something like this: 
     public enum EnumExample implements IntegerEnum
 {
     VAL1(1),
     VAL2(2),
     VAL3(5);
     private int value;
     private EnumExample(int val){value = val;}
     public int getIntValue(){return value;}
  }
    Only the listed values will translate to enums. Otherwise, the number will simply be reported

    • Method Detail

      • setValue

        public void setValue(T enumConstant)
        Update the value in this field with the number indicated by the enum NOTE: Any data structures that may depend on this value will not get updated. This map will need to be reinstantiated
        Parameters:
        enumConstant -

      • getValueAsEnum

        public T getValueAsEnum()
        Returns:
        the value in this field as represented by the enum with the matching integer value, or null if no enum matches the value

      • getValueAsString

        public java.lang.String getValueAsString(boolean printDecimal)
        Overrides:
        getValueAsString in class BufferMap.NumberField
        Parameters:
        printDecimal - - whether decimal should be printed. Decimal will only print if the value is outside of the range 0 - 9
        Returns:
        a formatted string representing the value of this field. If the data maps to an enum, also print the enum allows you to force print or force hide the printing of the decimal version of this field
